quote: Tarchannen Three Investigation.   Stardate 40164.7. Ensign Anthony   Brevelle Recording. Lieutenant   Susanna Leijten in command.
You up and running, Brevelle?
Yes, Lieutenant.
I've checked buildings Four and   Five... they're like all the   others... no phaser hits, no sign   of a fight. Looks like the entire   outpost just... vanished...
Lieutenant Leijten...
You'd better come see this...
No footprints... no vehicle   tracks. The wind probably erased   them... but look...
Freeze visual.
That's Hickman on the right...   that's Mendez on the left...   and as already noted, the   recording was made by Ensign   Brevelle... five years ago...
Commander Leijten, you said   Brevelle was ill last week for   several days before he...   deserted. What about Mendez?
Mendez was last seen aboard the   Aries an hour before she   disappeared. According to   witnesses, she seemed completely   normal.
And Hickman?
He just passed a routine   physical... with flying colors.
I know Paul Hickman. He's a   family man... two kids. I can't   believe he'd steal a shuttle and   desert...
Believe it, Geordi. He was   spotted by a Federation supply   ship yesterday... on a course   toward Tarchannen Three.
The original Tarchannen   disapperances were never solved,   were they?
No... we never learned what   happened or why. Forty-nine   people... gone...
And now, five years later, members   of the away team that investigated   the disappearances... have started   disappearing themselves.
Geordi and I are the only two   left.
Captain's log, Stardate 44664.5.   We have set a course to intercept   Lieutenant Hickman's stolen   shuttlecraft... and, hopefully,   to discover the whereabouts of   the other missing officers...
And then I almost married Paul   Bogrow...
Bogrow... which one was he?
You remember... with the thin   moustache...
Not Bogrow...
I know.
The one who used to drive you   crazy... you thought he was so   full of himself...
Well, I decided I prejudged him   unfairly...
Uh huh...
And then I decided I'd been right   in the first place.
(laughs, shakes his     head)   Bogrow...
And what about you... how come   you never found the right girl?
I enjoy the bachelor's life too   much...
That doesn't sound like my "little   brother" who always wanted advice   on women...
Well, you were obviously a great   advisor...
What do you think, Suz?
I don't know. But I'm not ashamed   to tell you...       I'm a little scared, you know?
Yeah, I know.
Well, if anybody's gonna figure   this out, it'll be the Leitjen   and La Forge Show, right? We   always made a good team...
A helluva team...
Commander La Forge, Commander   Leijten, report to the Bridge.   We have a fix on the missing   shuttle.
On our way, Commander.
Entering the Tarchannen system,   sir.
Slow to impulse power. Mister   Worf?
Long range sensors holding on the   shuttlecraft... bearing zero one   zero, mark two seven one.
Hail the vessel.
Lieutenant Hickman is not   responding, sir.
Put a repeating message on all   sub-space channels. Make it a   Priority One communique -- order   the Lieutenant to come about and   stand to.
Still no response, sir.
The craft is now within visual   range.
On screen.
The shuttle's acceleration is   increasing... its trajectory is   moving directly into the   planet's atmosphere.
He will reach an atmospheric   interface at an altitude of two   hundred and ten kilometers.
At his current speed, he'll   self-destruct.
That is correct, Commander.
How soon, Data?
Fifty-three seconds.
Options?
He's out of transporter range.
And he's too far away for a   positive lock with the tractor   beam.
Open a channel.
Open.
Lieutenant Hickman, listen   carefully. I am Captain Picard   of the Enterprise. You are in   danger. You must slow your rate   of approach.
The shuttle is approaching the   outer thermosphere, Captain.
He's panicking...
At current rate of acceleration,   the shuttlecraft will be destroyed   in twenty-eight seconds.
Sixteen seconds to impact.
Lieutenant Hickman, you must do   as I tell you. Reduce your   velocity and bring your craft to   a positive pitch of twenty   degrees... now.
The shuttle is entering the lower   ionosphere...
Sir, sensors detect two more   Federation shuttlecraft on the   planet's surface... no life signs.
Ready an away team, Number One.
Geordi, Data, Worf...
And Commander Leijten.
Commander Leijten, La Forge, check   the shuttle... Worf, Data, you've   got the perimeter.
It's the shuttle pod Mendez stole   from the Aries...
No life signs, sir.
Sir... I am certain that we are   being watched.
Commander Riker...
Where's Commander Leijten?
Susanna, report.
Fan out. Let's find her.
Susanna?
La Forge to Leijten...
Over here...
Where have you been?
Mendez... Brevelle... they're   alive. You saw the footprints?
Yes... but they're not human...
They're here. Stand still...   listen... and you can feel it...   they're here...
I'm not picking up anything...
Where are you going?
Susanna... ?
La Forge to Enterprise, medical   emergency, two to Sickbay.
Do I look as bad as I feel?
You look fine... now.
What happened?
Your blood chemistry is way off.   And you had a histamine response,   to what I don't know.       I'll run a complete blood and   tissue analysis.
I need to get back to the surface.
Uh uh... until we find some   answers, I don't want you to leave   the Enterprise.
But I have work...
Look, Commander, you may simply   have had an anxiety reaction down   there. But we've got to make   sure.
Probably wouldn't hurt to take   it easy for a while...
I'm not going to stay locked up   on this ship while the   investigation...

Your devotion to duty is   admirable, Commander... but Doctor   Crusher is right. You will remain   on the Enterprise until we know   whether or not this is connected   to the disappearance of the   others.
Captain...
We have completed our survey on   the surface. Analyzing that data   will keep all of us busy for some   time.
Of course, sir. I understand.
Data has a preliminary report...   if you feel up to it...
Sure... what're we waiting for?
Doctor... what about La Forge?
I gave him a complete bioscan.   Everything says he's in perfect   shape.
But according to all reports...   so were Mendez and Hickman before   they disappeared.

Captain Picard's wrong. The way   to handle this is to get back down   there with a dozen away teams...   fan out from the shuttle... We   can cover a lot of ground in a   hurry... use proximity detectors   and infrared sensors...
Susanna...
Geordi... it's started...   whatever happened to the others...   it's happening to me, too...
Suz... I'm here...       I'm not going to let anything   happen to you.
Main Bridge.
During microscopic examination   of the torn uniform, I discovered   these alien skin cells.
Source?
Undetermined.
Without something else to   cross-reference, it would take   weeks to try and identify them...
Fortunately, there is more   evidence...
We have been able to determine   that the footprints we found by   the shuttle were not made by any   known Tarchannen life form.
If we're pursuing a theory that   somehow unknown aliens are   involved... I should tell you we   didn't find tracks like that   during the original investigation.
The planet is subject to frequent   sandstorms. Footprints could have   been obliterated prior to your   arrival.
Doctor Crusher and I will begin   to search the medical database...   and attempt to match these with   a known life form.
Aliens or no aliens... why would   our people start returning after   five years to be... abducted?
Some kind of compulsion... like   a post hypnotic command... ?
Something that happened while we   were down there the first time...
We can go back to the mission   record... construct a log of   everyone's movements...
And look for a commonalty.   Something we all touched... maybe   a plant... the sand...
Or something we ingested... could   be in the air itself...
The parameters are pretty broad,   Data... any match we make is going   to be inconclusive at best.

quote: I am aware of that. However, I   see no other reasonable course   of investigation available to us.       And we may not have much time.
scene: 31   INT. BEVERLY'S OFFICE - TO INCLUDE WALL MONITOR

quote: You're worried about Geordi,   aren't you?
scene: 31   INT. BEVERLY'S OFFICE - TO INCLUDE WALL MONITOR

quote: I am an android. It is not   possible for me to feel anxiety.   Starfleet personnel have   vanished... others may be at risk.   We must do the best we can to find   out why.
scene: 31   INT. BEVERLY'S OFFICE - TO INCLUDE WALL MONITOR

quote: However...
scene: 31   INT. BEVERLY'S OFFICE - TO INCLUDE WALL MONITOR

quote: I am strongly motivated to solve   this mystery.
scene: 31   INT. BEVERLY'S OFFICE - TO INCLUDE WALL MONITOR

quote: Freeze visual.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: We're wasting our time.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: You didn't feel that way before...   it was your idea to look for some   sort of commonality.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Well... I was wrong.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: We're not going to find anything   this way. We should go back to   the planet... it's all down   there... everything we need to   know.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: That's not an option... not until   the Captain says it is...
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Computer resume.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: I can't look at this anymore.   It hurts my eyes... I can't think.   My brain feels like it's wrapped   in a blanket.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Take a break. I'll work for a...
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: I don't need a break... I...       ... I need to get off this ship.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: I think... we should go see Doctor   Crusher...
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Forget Crusher... forget your   logs. Tarchannen's down there,   Geordi. It's waiting for us.   That's where we should go.
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Susanna... you can't leave...
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Susanna...
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: SUSANNA!
scene: 32   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Her blood pressure's still   falling...       Apply the T-cell stimulator.   We've got to stabilize her immune   system.
She's developed an extreme   sensitivity to light... we're   trying to make her more   comfortable.
My God...
Geordi...
Hold on, Susanna. Doctor Crusher   will help you. Just... hold on.
It's inside me, Geordi... I can't   fight it... it's winning...
Don't give up... do you hear me,   Suz? You can't give up...
This is one of Susanna's altered   skin cells...
And this is one of the alien cells   Data found.
Almost identical. How do you   explain it?
Captain, I think the people who   disappeared from Tarchannen Three   weren't abducted... they were   transformed into another   species...
Can you stop it, Doctor?
The T-cell stimulator will slow   the rate of change... but until I   find the cause...
Doctor Crusher... is this a threat   to the Enterprise?
No. I've tested the cell wall   integrity. It's viability is   extremely low. It's not possible   for Susanna to transmit it.
Then how did she get it?
That's a good question. And it   would be a great help if I knew.       The only thing I do know,   Geordi... is that it's very   possible you'll be next.
I had two full bioscans today.   You said I was fine.
I gave Susanna a bioscan, too.   I didn't find anything wrong with   her, either.
How long?
I don't know what we're dealing   with. Brevelle was sick for days   before he left... Mendez was   normal an hour before she   disappeared. You may have   weeks... or just a few hours.
(after a thoughtful     beat)   Then there's no time to waste.   I've got to get back to work.
Geordi... until I know exactly   what we're dealing with, you're   staying here. In Sickbay.
Doctor, you said it would help   if you knew the source of this...
If I could finish my analysis of   the mission records... I might   find an answer.
And what if you begin to change...   and feel compelled to return to   the planet like the others?
Program the computer to monitor   my movements... that way you can   be sure I don't leave the ship.
What would you do, sir? Sit it   out in Sickbay... or try to learn   what it is that's got you... and   maybe stop it?
All right, Mister La Forge...   proceed with your investigation.   But report to Doctor Crusher for   another bioscan at the start of   day watch.
In the meantime, if you have   symptoms of any kind -- I want   to know. Immediately.
Understood.
One to transport.

quote: Okay, computer...

quote: Geordi... may I inquire how your   investigation is proceeding?

quote: It's not.

quote: Have you done an audio analysis...

quote: And a spectrographic analysis and   a screen for ionizing radiation...   and I even ran an enhancement for   micro-seismic disturbances. I've   tried it all.
scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: I'm sorry, Data.
scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: There is no need for an apology.
scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: You're probably right, Data. But   I've got to finish scanning these   records... while I can.
scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: Is there some way I can assist   you?
scene: 42   INT. ENGINEERING - GEORDI'S OFFICE - ON WALL MONITOR

quote: If I knew what I was looking   for...       I think it's just down to going   over it, Data... maybe find   something I forgot... I'll let   you know if I come up with   anything... anything at all.

quote: Sorry to disturb you, Doctor...
It's alright. What's happened?
I thought you should see this.
Her skin's simulating the light...   a radiant reaction...       Some sort of mimetic ability?
That's not all. Her body   temperature is dropping.
It's as if she's generating a   disruptive field... I can barely   get readings off her now... What   about her rate of transformation?
It's increasing.

That's not possible. It should   have been inhibited by the   T-cell stimulator... unless...       If there's a foreign body inside   her that's producing these   changes... something like a   viral creche...
A very small one if our scans   haven't found it.
I want a full genetic analysis.   We're going to examine any   abnormality we find... no matter   how insignificant it seems.
One to transport.
Computer, delete the audio.
Wait a minute... freeze visual.
Whose shadow is that?
Please restate question.
Computer... the shadow currently   displayed in section B-eleven...   what is its source?
Unknown.
It's gotta belong to somebody...       Computer... return to time index   fourteen five eight...
Okay... Brevelle's behind the   camera... Susanna and I head off   in that direction. Mendez moves   off that way...       ... so whose shadow is it?
Computer... replay visual from   last time index. No audio.   Slow to fifty percent.
Freeze visual.
Magnify four times... apply   spectral enhancement.
Computer, do you have sufficient   data to compile a Holographic   simulation of this Visual Record?
A simulation would be limited to   areas scanned by the visual   recording device.
Good. Fine. Scan the entire   record... then recreate it in   Holodeck Three.
Computer, is the Tarchannen   simulation ready?
Affirmative. Program complete.   Enter when ready.
Computer, scan Starfleet records   and create a simulation of   Brevelle... place him where he   stood while recording this...
Good. Computer, based on their   speed and direction, can you   extrapolate each officer's   movements as they walk out of   the recording device's field of   view?
Affirmative. With an increasing   probability of error, reaching   ninety-five percent after ten   seconds.
Understood. Run simulation.
I want to make another sweep of   the perimeter. Mendez, Brevelle,   start at Building Two. La Forge,   you and I will begin at Four.
It's happening too fast.       Freeze program.
Computer, reverse simulation...   run it back to... time index   fourteen five eight.
Freeze.
Computer... remove Leijten...
Remove La Forge...
... and now remove Mendez...
Computer, using vector analysis,   identify the source of this   shadow.
There is no object in the program   which could generate the shadow.
There must be something else   here... something between the   camera lights and the wall.
Computer, given the distance from   the lights to the wall... can you   determine the most likely shape   and position of the object casting   this shadow?
There is insufficient data to   reconstruct the requested object.
Okay... let's assume the height   of our friend here is about my   size... say one hundred seventy   centimeters... now can you   extrapolate its shape and   position?
Affirmative.
Do it.
There... in the thymus...
(studying the figures,     puzzled)   Some kind of parasite. It's using   Susanna's immune system to spread   genetic instructions...
How did it get there?
She could have been infected   during the original mission. It's   small enough to have entered   through any of the mucous   membranes...
But it certainly isn't acting like   a typical parasite... it's not   feeding off her -- it's actually   transforming her DNA to match its   own...
There's not much of her original   DNA left.
And we're going to need unaltered   genes... or we'll never get her   back. We've got to get that thing   out of her. Now.
Any luck?
Negative, Commander. Nothing in   our survey suggests the source of   a parasitic infection...
Crusher to Bridge.
Go ahead, Doctor.
The surgery was successful...
... but it will be a few hours   before we know how her   regenerative systems are   responding... In the meantime,   I'd better get Geordi in here.
Very good, Doctor. Keep us   advised.
Crusher to La Forge...
Computer, locate Commander La   Forge.
Commander La Forge is not on board   the Enterprise.
Bridge, the Computer says Geordi   isn't on board... ? Is that   correct?
I show no transporter activity.
All shuttles are secure.
Negative, Doctor. There is no   indication he left the ship.
Computer, what was Commander La   Forge's last known location?
Holodeck Three.
Worf...
Captain, if Geordi has   transformed, he may be virtually   a chameleon -- the skin develops   mimetic capabilities... he could   still be onboard...
... but undetectable to our   sensors...
Search the structure... I will   take the perimeter...
Commander...
Security...
Captain... the security lockout   on Transporter Room Six has been   broken.
Re-engage... now.
I cannot, sir... The transport   cycle has already begun.
I do not read any life signs on   the surface.
Our sensor array is useless...   we have to find another way of   locating him.
Captain, if we can get close   enough to Geordi... we can read   his absorption spectrum with an   ultraviolet light.
Can you modify an emergency beacon   to operate on UV?
Yes, sir.
Make it so. Number One, as soon   as Data is ready, I want you to   lead an away team.
How long, Mister Data?
(continuing to work as     he talks)   I still must replace the emitter   module and reconnect the power   supply. It will take   approximately two minutes to   complete the modification.
Hedrick to Commander Riker.
Go ahead.
I've been able to determine La   Forge's transport coordinates.
He beamed down next to the Aries   shuttle.
Acknowledged.
He's on foot... couldn't have   gotten far by now. Let's assume   a radius of ten kilometers...
That is still a search area of   more than three hundred square   kilometers.
We've got to narrow it down.   What's happening with the enhanced   sensor arrays?
All scans are still negative.
There has to be some way to track   him.       What about the high resolution   EM scans?
We are adjusting the sensors to   read Commander La Forge's   absorption spectrum... but it   will take several hours.
Geordi doesn't have several hours.
I have completed the   modifications, Commander.
Doctor Crusher... meet us in   Transporter Room Six.   Immediately.
... And I'm going to need a   sedative for him... Get me ten   cc's of kayolane...
Doctor Crusher...
You look a lot better than you   did an hour ago...
What did you do?
We removed some kind of parasite   from your thymus...

No.       It wasn't a parasite, Doctor.    (with new found inner     knowledge)   It's their method of   reproduction... to plant a DNA   strand in a living host... that   causes a metamorphosis.       ... Geordi?
He's gone...
Yes...
He's on the planet...
Don't try to get up yet...
We have to find him...
An away team is about to start   a search.
You'll never be able to find   him...       I'm the only one who can.
No... you must turn them off...   the light frightens them...
(to Susanna; re: the     emergency beacon)   What about the ultraviolet?
That is beyond their visual   spectrum... they will not run from   it.
He could be several kilometers   away by now.
No... he's here... they're all   here...
There.
Geordi...
Geordi... stop...
Wait here...
Geordi, my voice is familiar...   listen to it... you can feel that   we share this... you know I am   not a threat...
The others... Mendez, Brevelle,   they no longer exist as humans...   but a part of you still does.   You are not one of them... not   yet. I can help you... if you'll   just trust me...
I know what's going on inside   you... the war you're fighting   with yourself... the humanity   slipping away... the instinct to   run... It's overpowering, but   they know how to beat it now...
Look at me... I've come back...   Let me take you back, too.
Just take my hand... please...
Crusher to Enterprise. Lock on   to Commander Leitjen's signal...   prepare to transport two directly   to Sickbay.
We're going home, Geordi.
Is there no hope for the others?   Brevelle, Mendez...
None.
Susanna...
I'm here, Geordi. So's Doctor   Crusher and Captain Picard.
Lieutenant Commander La Forge   reporting for duty, Captain.
Welcome back, Mister La Forge.
This species... can we communicate   with them?
No. They act on instinct alone.       In another few minutes, I wouldn't   have responded to you at all,   Susanna.
Then we shall leave them be. I'll   order warning beacons placed in   orbit and on the surface.   Hopefully, no one else will have   to go through what you did.
Down there, I didn't know who you   were... and yet somehow I   believed you... trusted you...
Must've been all the good advice   I used to give you...
Thank you.
